ParentCompanyName: E.I. duPont de Nemours & Co., Inc.
OperatorName: E.I. duPont de Nemours & Co., Inc.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES

The DuPont El Dorado Plant has implement Process Safety Management processes and procedures that meet the requirements of DuPont Corporate SHE Standard S21A, Process Safety Management. These DuPont Corporate policies can be summarized as follows:
- All Safety and Environmental incidents are preventable
- The Goal is Zero - Zero Incidents Period
- All employees and contractors are responsible for their individual safety

The Corporate policies are embodied in the numerous Safety, Health, and Environmental (SHE) and Engineering Standards, which apply globally.  At the El Dorado Plant, the policies will be implemented through the Standard Operating Procedures, Process Technology Descriptions, Process Hazards Reviews, Training Procedures, Compliance Audits, Safe Work Practises, and Management of Change Procedures.  These procedures are provided in hard copy form to all employees.  Employee Involvement Policies encourage improvement ideas from all employees and provide for employee participation in all aspects of Accident Prevention Activities.  

Prevention Programs dealing with Maintenance and Contractor Safety are provided by Service Level Agreements (SLA) with the site landlord, Great Lakes Chemical, and are described by their procedures.  Emergency Response is also provided via SLA and is described in the sitewide Emergency response Procedures.

FACILITY DESCRIPTION

The DuPont El Dorado Plant consists of process equipment located on 8.8 acres of land leased from the Great Lakes Chemical at their South Plant Site.  The Great Lakes Chemical South Plant Site is a total of 430 acres located in Union County, south of the town of El Dorado, AR.  The Fluorine Chemicals operations were purchased from Great Lakes Chemical in 2008.  Great Lakes Chemical operated these facilities until the sale to DuPont.  Great Lakes Chemical continues to operate other processes on the site which are considered to be

a separate "stationary Source" for the purpose of 40CFR part 68.

The DuPont El Dorado Plant consists of 4 manufacturing units used to produce fluorinated industrial gases:
- FM200 Unit
- Trifluoropropane (TFP) Unit
- Flex Unit
- Pharma Unit

These productions units use the regulated substances of Anhydrous Hydrogen Fluoride and Ethylene as raw materials for chemical systhesis.  On site storage volume of the regulated substances is above the threshhold quantities specified in 40 CFR part 68.

GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND CHEMICAL SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS

The DuPont El Dorado Plant has implement Process Safety Management processes and procedures that meet the requirements of DuPont Corporate SHE Standard S21A, Process Safety Management.  This Standard includes and embraces the requirements of 29 CFR 1910.119 and 40 CFR Part 68.

Our Safety Programs include:

Designing for Safety:
- A documented process technology system which covers the hazards of materials, process design basis, and equipment design basis.
- Extensive accident prevention and mitigation systems.
- Applicable codes and standards which are met or exceeded.
- Materials of construction are chosen to provide mechanical integrity.
- Quality Assurance ensures fabrication in accordance with design specifications and proper assembly

Maintaining our Plant:
- Maintenance personnel are trained and experienced personnel provided by Great Lakes chemical
- Contractors are trained and qualified by Great Lakes Chemical
- A work permit system controls hazards associated with maintenance work.

Operating Safety:
- Operators are trained and job qualified.
-Technical resources are available and utilized as required.
- Operators follow approved written procedures.

Auditing our Operations:
- Routine safety inspections are conducted.
- Corporate, independent and governmental audits and reviews are conducted.
- Process Hazards Analyses are conducted.
- Safety critical eq

uipment is set up on periodic inspection frequency to ensure mechanical intregrity.
- Pre-startup Safety Reviews are conducted prior to starting up any new or modified equipment.
- Quality assurance of critical equipment ensures fabrication in accordance with design specifications.
- All incidents are investigated and actions taken to prevent recurrence.

SAFETY IS A JOB REQUIREMENT FOR ALL EMPLOYEES AND CONTRACTORS!

FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

No applicable accidents have occurred in the past five years.

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

Emergency response is provided by the site Landlord, Great Lakes Chenical, via a Service Level Agreement (SLA).  The DuPont El Dorado Plant units and chemicals are included in the Great Lakes Chemical South Plant written emergency response plan that deals with accidental releases of hazardous materials.  The plan includes all aspects of emergency response including adequate first aid and medical treatment, evacuations, notification of local emergency response agencies and the public, as well as post-incident decontamination.  Annual drills are conducted and critiqued to assure readiness and adequacy of the emergency response plan.  The emergency response plan is promptly updated to reflect any changes required as a result of learnings from drills or for process changes that require modified emergency response.

To ensure proper functioning, the site emergency response equipment is regularily inspected and serviced.

Union County Arkansas is the Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC) with which the Great Lakes Chemical South Plant site emergency response plan is coordinated.

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

The DuPont El Dorado Plant plans to continue efforts to improve safety through corporate audits and response plans to bring the site into better alignment with overall DuPont corporate policies and standards.
